'Robert Francis "Bob" McDonnell' (born June 15, 1954) is an American politician
who has been the 71st Governor of Virginia since January 16, 2010. A former
lieutenant colonel in the United States Army, McDonnell served in the Virginia
House of Delegates from 1993 to 2006 and served as Attorney General of Virginia
from 2006 to 2009. He currently serves on the executive committee of the
Republican Governors Association.

McDonnell was elected as the Governor of Virginia on the back of the campaign
slogan, "Bob's for Jobs", defeating Democratic state Senator Creigh
Deeds by a 17-point margin in a 2009 general election marked by the late-2000s
recession. McDonnell was inaugurated on January 16, 2010, on the steps of the
Virginia State Capitol, to succeed Tim Kaine.

Since taking office, McDonnell has pushed for privatization, extending a
contract to outsource the state's computer operations and attempting to auction
off the state's ABC liquor stores, and promoted offshore drilling for Virginia.
He has sought to fund transportation improvements from non-traditional revenues
sources including the proposal to auction-off liquor stores. He has used his
amendatory veto power to restrict state funding for abortions. McDonnell is
constantly ranked as one of the most liked and respected governors in the nation. http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/the-fix/post/the-nations-10-
most-popular-governors--and-
why/2012/04/11/gIQA9dlzAT_blog.html http://www.nbcwashington.com/blog-
s/first-read-dmv/Mr-Popularity-Gov-McDonnell-Gets-High-Approval-Rating-in-New-

whispers/2012/03/20/even-beloved-bob-mcdonnell-cant-save-romney-in-virginia-
